intro: Cenostigma myabense, commonly known as the Myabense thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy flowers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, and it thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
